intro: Tauschia alpina, commonly known as the alpine tauschia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, often in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant features slender stems with opposite, pinnately compound leaves that are usually hairy. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Tauschia alpina is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous areas across Europe and Asia.
